page.title: 11M54 MOTORWAY
page.content: The M54 was built especially to link Telford to the country's national motorway network. It has helped people who work in Birmingham and Telford because now you can get to Birmingham within half an hour, London within two and half hours and Telford within twenty minutes drive.The faster and easier travel has turned Telford into a very busy place. Because of the easy access to Telford, new businesses have set up and now the government is making a profit. The motorway cost 65M pounds to build because there are a lot of banks that the motorway is set on and a lot of bridges like the one between Brewood and Codsall.The M54 / M6 link-up opened on the 25th November 1983.
